question: Which revolutionary was charged with Mainpuri Conspiracy in 1919?
explanation: Ram Prasad Bismil, through his revolutionary organisation Matrivedi, and Genda Lal Dixit, through his armed youth organisation Shivaji Samiti, mobilised youths in Etawah, Mainpuri, Agra and Shahjahanpur to collect funds for the party through loot of the government treasury in 1918. The whole plan came to be known as the ‘Mainpuri Conspiracy’. The Judiciary Magistrate of Mainpuri held Dixit, Bismil and others as absconders on 1 November 1919.
